summary: This is an email chain from August 2019 discussing the FBI's retrieval of video recordings from the camera system at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). The email indicates the recording capabilities will be offline for 8-10 days during data retrieval, but live monitoring will remain available.

events.title: FBI Retrieves MCC Camera Recordings
events.description: The FBI informs MCC staff they will be retrieving previous recordings from the camera system, causing recording capabilities to be offline for 8-10 days during data retrieval.

keyFacts: The FBI was retrieving video recordings from the camera system at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in August 2019.
The recording system was expected to be offline for 8-10 days during the data retrieval process.
Live viewing/monitoring capabilities at MCC remained available while recordings were being retrieved.
The email correspondence occurred shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death at MCC on August 10, 2019.
The document suggests an investigation into security/surveillance systems at the facility where Epstein died.
